name: Hard Rock Hotel Bali

reviews.text: One of the continual challenges I face with having two boisterous boys is what accommodation to book. Two rooms, so they can get up to mischief, one big room ,so that none of us get any sleep or privacy, or a suite that may or may not have decent sofabeds.. The Hard Rock Hotel suites solve this problem . As well as the beds in the masterbedroom there are two day beds in the living room that make perfectly good single beds. No, complaints from my mini consumers at all ,and lots of room for all of us. This hotel is excellent for familiies in this predicament. Also its fun. The pool is really huge. (I know everyone says that, but it really is). Cabanas round the pool are worth hiring for a chill out.. Location is very good in the middle of Kuta, with the beach across the road,with a on site Surf school, and tour office. (Of course more expensive than outside, but not a rip off, and you feel that you can trust them with your little dears. ) Breakfast is pretty good, though we ate outside of the hotel most evenings, as it is typical big hotel fare.,and there are many local options. (We liked "Uns")The bars are expensive, (fun sitting in the pool up to you tummy in water,and sipping a beer though.)and I wouldn t go to the Hard Rock Hotel looking for a Hard Rock boozy experience.The bands were just ok. Typical big hotel bands playing standards type stuff.
reviews.title: Great for old rockers and their kids

likes.liked: — Big rooms with effective airconditioning and comfy beds

reviews.text: Its not cheap, and its not particularily luxurious. But as a good family base for doing some family bonding, and exploring Bali. (A bit grotty), I dont think we could have chosen a better hotel for our needs. But apparently try and avoid Indonesia school holidays, when the pool will be crowded.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in mid June 2007 for five nights with my wife. Booked through a travel agent with Singapore Airlines tickets. It is a rather fun hotel by the beach. Had a free welcome drink at centrestage. They have live band there everynight. Breakfast is included and rather good. But got bore of it after 5 days even though they changed it slightly everyday. The deluxe room is clean and spacious. We loved the extra long louge chair in the room. The pool is huge with sandy beach like feature. There's also a pool basketball net and beach volleyball. Cool! There is another VIP pool which is rather quiet but we did not swim there. We did an hour and a half SPA treatment which is great. We also took their surfing class and I manage to surf quite a few waves! Bali is really fun (and cheap with good bargaining). We will stay here again next time, but then with so many good hotels in Bali, who knows....
reviews.title: Activities Filled Hotel

likes.disliked: — No free internet. Only paid ones.

reviews.text: I've stayed in HRH Bali from 24 - 28 April 2007 with my family. We booked 2 Standard Room for 5 days 4 nights trip while in Kuala Lumpur, but when we check in....the front office personnel said it was our lucky day, so they upgrade our room to Deluxe instead, yippie! The rooms are nice, we got 2 queen beds in each room and they still roomy. I open up the glass door to my balcony, but its really looks like a jungle back there, with a sound of water pump once a while clogging beneath my balcony....its not nice at all.
reviews.title: COOL HOTEL

likes.disliked: — No shampoo + soap to take home!

reviews.text: Then, instead of having a seperate HRH soap, shampoo, etc.....i'm a bit disappointed since HRH only provide an all-in-one shampoo + soap's container fix to the wall. Then, the slippers in the room are chargeable and not even free. So, I was thinking that I paid quite a sum of money to "get" all these?? Well, think again....
reviews.title: OK place

reviews.text: Apart from that, my family really enjoy the centerstage + HRCafe free admission and this hotel is just a walking distance to all major shopping arcade in Kuta. In the near future, I maybe stay in Alam Kul Kul instead for a change but no offence, HRH is really a COOL hotel, cheers!

reviews.text: First, let's start with the positive: yes, the pool is amazing. And the lobby transforms into a concert hall at night, which is indeed lively. (The quality of the band, unfortunately, didn't go beyond your average high school garage band, so not that exciting). The location, too, is very good: right in the thick of things, and the beach is a mere stroll.
reviews.title: Lively Hotel

description: Asia's first Hard Rock Hotel, covering a prime 3 hectare site at the heart of Bali's entertainment and shopping district, features 418 tribute rooms and suites fit for a rock star.
